title: Waste Management Posts Lower 3Q Profit
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Waste Management Inc. (WM) said its third-quarter profit decreased as costs rose, though revenue climbed.

The company posted net income of $495 million, or $1.16 a share, compared with $499 million, or $1.16 a share, in the year-ago quarter. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting $1.13 a share.

On an adjusted basis, earnings were $1.19 a share, up from $1.15 a share in the year-earlier period. Analysts were looking for $1.14 a share.

Operating revenue for the quarter rose to $3.97 billion from $3.82 billion a year ago, driven by volume growth in the company's collection and disposal business. Analysts expected $4 billion in revenue.

Costs and expenses rose to $3.23 billion from $3.12 billion in the prior year.
